fields.value: ABC News/Washington Post Iraq Casualties Poll, July 2003

dsDescriptionValue.value:
This special topic poll, conducted July 9-10, 2003, was  undertaken to assess public opinion on the war with Iraq. Respondents  were asked to give their opinions on the economic and human costs of  the war against Iraq, the effectiveness of President George W. Bush,  other countries' opinions of the United States as a result of the war,  and the upcoming 2004 presidential election. Other of questions  addressed the current and future casualties of the war, the necessity  of locating Iraqi leader
Saddam Hussein, the length of time necessary  for the United States military to be in Iraq, the eventual costs and  benefits of the war with Iraq, and the political impact of the war  with Iraq. Background variables include age, sex, political orientation, education, and ethnicity.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XIV.C.1. Mass Political Behavior and Attitudes, Public Opinion on Political Matters, United States

fields.value: Version Date: 2003-10-09Version Text: 2003-10-09 Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: SPSS portable file;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: (1) Additional information about sampling,  interviewing, weighting, and sampling error may be found in the  codebook. (2) The data are provided as an SPSS portable file. (3) This  collection has not been processed by ICPSR staff. ICPSR is  distributing the data and documentation for this collection in  essentially the same form in which they were received. When  appropriate, documentation has been converted to Portable Document  Format (PDF), data files have been converted to non-platform-specific  formats, and variables have been recoded to ensure respondents'  privacy. (4) The codebook is provided by ICPSR as a Portable Document  Format (PDF) file. The PDF file format was developed by Adobe Systems  Incorporated and can be accessed using PDF reader software, such as  the Adobe Acrobat Reader. Information on how to obtain a copy of the Acrobat Reader is provided on the ICPSR Web site.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: SPSS portable file(s), and electronic documentation.;

distributorName.value: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

value: Persons aged 18 and over living in households with telephones in the contiguous 48 United States.

fields.value: Households were selected by random-digit dialing. Within  households, the respondent selected was the adult living in the  household who last had a birthday and who was home at the time of the interview.
